newsitem.title: UK: European cotton markets see patchy demand.
newsitem.headline: European cotton markets see patchy demand.

text.p: Cotton sellers in Poland and France found fresh demand for Central Asian styles for nearby delivery at relatively steady prices, industry sources reported on Wednesday.
Elsewhere Europe's markets were quiet with only occasional spinner enquiry for low-volume shipments to cover gaps caused by delayed deliveries of Central Asian origins, they said.
The common cry from suppliers was that the strong U.S. dollar was discouraging mill-buyers from re-entering the market, they added. --London Newsroom, +44 171 542 8071
